meanings.definition: Blook (noun): A fictional book that is published online in installments.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy reading a blook every night before bed.
meanings.sent2: The author decided to release their novel as a blook on the internet.
meanings.sent3: The blook I'm reading has such an interesting plot twist!
meanings.sent4: Her imagination turned the story into a blook that captivated readers.
meanings.sent5: The blook's characters feel so real, like they could step out of the pages.

meanings.definition: Blook (verb): To combine elements of a blog and a book in a publication.
meanings.sent1: Authors often blook their content to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent2: She decided to blook her travel experiences for her followers.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I would see someone blook a diary!
meanings.sent4: His writing style blooks traditional storytelling with modern blogging.
meanings.sent5: The way she blooks her posts makes them engaging and informative.

meanings.definition: Blook (adjective): Describing a publication that originated as a blog but has been turned into a book.
meanings.sent1: The blook version of the blog had additional chapters and illustrations.
meanings.sent2: She proudly displayed her blook collection on the bookshelf.
meanings.sent3: It's fascinating how a blog can transform into a blook!
meanings.sent4: The blook cover design perfectly captures the essence of the original blog.
meanings.sent5: The blook format allows for a seamless transition from online to print.
